verbose_text: However, the greater propensity of the DeltaN-term-DeltaGPI-CD44 constructs to reside in DRMs (as compared to the equivalent DeltaGPI-CD44 constructs) indicates that, at least in HEK293-T cells, the removal of the N-terminal region of CD317 is enough to increase the DRM localisation of a CD317 construct in which the GPI anchor has been replaced by the TM domain of CD44.
evidence: CD317 is enough to increase the DRM localisation of a CD317 construct
